intro: Hypocalymma boroniaceum, commonly known as the Boronia hypocalymma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, narrow leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Hypocalymma boroniaceum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable climates.
